name: hubot-httpdog
readme:
# hubot-httpdog

[![Build Status](https://travis-ci.org/t-richards/hubot-httpdog.svg?branch=master)](https://travis-ci.org/t-richards/hubot-httpdog)
[![npm](https://img.shields.io/npm/v/hubot-httpdog.svg?maxAge=2592000)](https://www.npmjs.com/package/hubot-httpdog)

[HTTP Status Dogs][httpdog-site] integration for [Hubot][hubot]

# Installation

In your Hubot repository, run

```bash
$ npm install --save hubot-httpdog
```

Then add **hubot-httpdog** to your `external-scripts.json`.

```json
["hubot-httpdog"]
```

# Commands

```
hubot http <code> - Displays the relevant HTTP status code image for <code>
```

# Help

> The status image for status code X does not work, what gives?

Not all HTTP status codes have images associated with them yet. Check out
the official [HTTP Status Dogs website][httpdog-site] to see a complete list of supported status codes!
